title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
desc: A classic novel set in the South during the 1930s, focusing on the trial of a black man accused of raping a white woman.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
desc: A coming-of-age novel that follows a teenager named Holden Caulfield as he wanders around New York City after getting expelled from his prep school.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
desc: A trilogy of fantasy novels set in the world of Middle-earth, following hobbit Frodo Baggins as he journeys to destroy the One Ring.

author: George Orwell
desc: A dystopian novel set in a future where the government has total control over every aspect of citizens' lives, and where independent thought is punished.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
desc: A classic novel about the lives of the Bennett sisters and their attempts to find love and marriage in Georgian-era England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
desc: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties that explores themes of love, wealth, and the American Dream through the story of millionaire Jay Gatsby.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
desc: A magical realist novel that tells the story of the Buendia family over the course of seven generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
desc: A comedic science fiction novel that follows the misadventures of hapless human Arthur Dent and his alien friend Ford Prefect as they travel through space.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
desc: A series of seven fantasy novels that follow the adventures of a group of children who stumble upon a magical world called Narnia.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
desc: A memoir that chronicles the experiences of a young Jewish girl named Anne Frank during World War II, as she and her family hide from the Nazis in Amsterdam.
